content.body: What’s the current best-practice way to programmatically detect if a document is in a frame?

> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> What’s the current best-practice way to programmatically detect if a document is in a frame?

I guess https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/frameElement ?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @sideshowbarker:mozilla.org
What’s the current best-practice way to programmatically detect if a document is in a frame?
I guess https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/frameElement ?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> What’s the current best-practice way to programmatically detect if a document is in a frame?

I guess https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/frameElement ?

In reply to @sideshowbarker:mozilla.org
What’s the current best-practice way to programmatically detect if a document is in a frame?
I guess https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/frameElement ?

content.body: (I usually do something like `window.parent !== window.self` but `frameElement` feels more like a best practice)
content.formatted_body: (I usually do something like window.parent !== window.self but frameElement feels more like a best practice)
